intro: Dicliptera scorpioides, commonly known as the scorpion grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in wetlands and disturbed soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in moist environments and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas. Dicliptera scorpioides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
